summary: This is an email chain from July 24, 2019, discussing an incident where Jeffrey Epstein was found unconscious in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) with marks on his neck. The email notes his cellmate was Nick Tartaglione, a former police officer charged with a quadruple homicide, and mentions the Washington Post has inquired about the incident.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email; found unconscious in his cell at MCC with red marks on his neck, revived but could not recall what happened.

persons.name: Nick Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate at MCC; a former police officer and subject of a quadruple homicide case approved for the death penalty; denied knowledge of the incident.

persons.name: Ponder
persons.context: Mentioned as someone to be looped in to have an agent who covers jails work contacts for details about the Epstein incident.

connections.description: Were sharing a cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) when Epstein was found unconscious.

events.title: Epstein found unconscious in cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unconscious in his cell at MCC with red marks on his neck. He was revived by staff but could not recall what happened. His cellmate, Nick Tartaglione, denied knowledge. An investigation was initiated by MCC.

locations: HVRA (likely Hudson Valley region reference for Tartaglione case)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found unconscious in his cell at MCC with red marks on his neck on or before July 23, 2019.
Epstein's cellmate was Nick Tartaglione, a former police officer charged with a quadruple homicide and approved for the death penalty.
The Washington Post made an inquiry about the incident, indicating media attention.
MCC initiated a standard operating procedure investigation into the incident.
The email chain involves FBI New York Office personnel discussing the incident and planning to gather more details.
